meanings.sent1: The priest had to deconsecrate the old church before it could be sold.
meanings.sent2: The ancient ritual was performed to deconsecrate the sacred ground.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous children joked that they would deconsecrate the playground by playing too rough.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to deconsecrate the peaceful atmosphere of the garden.
meanings.sent5: The act of deconsecrating the temple was met with mixed emotions from the community.

meanings.definition: to make something no longer sacred or holy
meanings.sent1: The vandals attempted to deconsecrate the shrine by defacing it.
meanings.sent2: The ancient curse threatened to deconsecrate the sacred artifact.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick seemed to deconsecrate the traditional beliefs of the audience.
meanings.sent4: The dark magic was said to deconsecrate any object it touched.
meanings.sent5: The forbidden ritual was believed to deconsecrate the entire temple.
